definitions.definition: To move swiftly.
(fluids) To flow.
(of a vessel) To sail before the wind, in distinction from reaching or sailing close-hauled.
To control or manage, be in charge of.
definitions.example: He is running the candidate's expensive campaign.

definitions.definition: To be a candidate in an election.
definitions.example: I have decided to run for governor of California.

definitions.definition: To make run in a race or an election.
definitions.example: He ran his best horse in the Derby.

definitions.definition: To exert continuous activity; to proceed.
definitions.example: to run through life; to run in a circle

definitions.definition: To be presented in the media.
definitions.example: Her picture ran on the front page of the newspaper.

definitions.definition: To print or broadcast in the media.
definitions.example: run a story; run an ad

definitions.definition: To smuggle (illegal goods).
definitions.example: to run guns; to run rum

definitions.definition: To sort through a large volume of produce in quality control.
definitions.example: Looks like we're gonna have to run the tomatoes again.

definitions.definition: To extend or persist, statically or dynamically, through space or time.
To execute or carry out a plan, procedure or program.
definitions.example: Don't run that software unless you have permission.

definitions.definition: To pass or go quickly in thought or conversation.
definitions.example: to run from one subject to another

definitions.definition: To become different in a way mentioned (usually to become worse).
definitions.example: Our supplies are running low.

definitions.definition: To cost a large amount of money.
definitions.example: Buying a new laptop will run you a thousand dollars.

definitions.definition: Of stitches or stitched clothing, to unravel.
definitions.example: My stocking is running.

definitions.definition: To pursue in thought; to carry in contemplation.
To cause to enter; to thrust.
definitions.example: to run a sword into or through the body; to run a nail into one's foot

definitions.definition: To drive or force; to cause, or permit, to be driven.
To cause to be drawn; to mark out; to indicate; to determine.
definitions.example: to run a line

definitions.definition: To encounter or incur (a danger or risk).
definitions.example: to run the risk of losing one's life

definitions.definition: To put at hazard; to venture; to risk.
To tease with sarcasms and ridicule.
To sew (a seam) by passing the needle through material in a continuous line, generally taking a series of stitches on the needle at the same time.
To control or have precedence in a card game.
definitions.example: Every three or four hands he would run the table.

definitions.definition: To be in form thus, as a combination of words.
To be popularly known; to be generally received.
To have growth or development.
definitions.example: Boys and girls run up rapidly.

definitions.definition: To tend, as to an effect or consequence; to incline.
To have a legal course; to be attached; to continue in force, effect, or operation; to follow; to go in company.
definitions.example: Certain covenants run with the land.

definitions.definition: To encounter or suffer (a particular, usually bad, fate or misfortune).
To strike (the ball) in such a way as to cause it to run along the ground, as when approaching a hole.
To speedrun.
The action of the verb to run.
definitions.example: His running of the business leaves something to be desired.

definitions.definition: The activity of running as a form of exercise, as a sport, or for any other reason
definitions.example: Running is good exercise.

definitions.definition: That which runs or flows; the quantity of a liquid which flows in a certain time or during a certain operation.
definitions.example: the first running of a still

definitions.definition: The discharge from an ulcer or other sore.
Moving or advancing at a run.
Present, current.
definitions.example: running month

definitions.definition: Flowing; easy; cursive.
definitions.example: running handwriting

definitions.definition: Continuous; ongoing; keeping along step by step.
definitions.example: a running explanation

definitions.definition: Having a continuous design or pattern.
definitions.example: running bond; running ornament

definitions.definition: Consecutive.
Extending by a slender climbing or trailing stem.
definitions.example: a running vine

definitions.definition: Discharging pus.
definitions.example: a running sore

definitions.definition: (of a nose) Discharging snot or mucus.
definitions.example: a running nose

definitions.definition: Consecutively; in a row
definitions.example: Mom's strawberry jam won the blue ribbon at the Holland County Fair three years running.

definitions.definition: Approaching; about; roughly.
